channel.title: Extremetech
channel.description: Core Technology How-to, Reviews, News and Commentary
channel.copyright: Copyright 2004 Ziff Davis Media Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: SBC Plans Nationwide VOIP Rollout
item.description: SBC deploys VOIP in Los Angeles, Dallas, Chicago and San Antonio.

item.title: ADV: Win an Epson L-410 Digital Camera and Energizer Compact Charger!
item.description: Energizer brings you it’s Hi-Charge Sweepstakes with your chance to win an Epson Digital Camera and Compact Charger with AA 2500 batteries, the hardest working Energizer rechargeable battery ever, so you never miss a shot.

item.title: HP, Mitel Partner for VOIP
item.description: HP and Mitel Networks partner to offer converged IP solutions.

item.title: Brillian Signs LCOS Distribution Agreement
item.description: Holoeye will distribute Brillian products to specialty markets.

item.title: American Modder: Computer Bike
item.description: ExtremeTech's Master Modder continues the challenge of constructing the first ever "Motorcycle Mod." What surprises are in store for him?

item.title: ATI Announces New Mobile GPUs
item.description: The Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) formerly known as M28 now becomes Mobility Radeon X800, and ATI also unveiled its new Mobility Radeon X300 for Thin/Light Notebooks. Plus, ATI is planning to bring some of its CE HDTV technology into its GPUs.

item.title: Novell Launches New Linux Operating System
item.description: Review: Novell takes aim at the corporate desktop with their release of Novell Desktop Linux 9. Jim Lynch takes a look at the new release from the lone desktop perspective. Can a distro targeted at the hearts and minds of business users find a home in the home?

item.title: MPAA Seeks Internet2 Tests, P2P Monitor Role
item.description: The Motion Picture Association of America is looking into Internet2 as a way to deliver DVD-quality movies.

item.title: Free Advice for PR People
item.description: Notes from the Lab: Why do some products get reviewed and others don't? The answer lies in the attitudes of PR people and how difficult they set the bar to get their damn product. Oh, and we take a look at this short week on ExtremeTech.

item.title: AOpen's SFF Media PC Hits the Living Room
item.description: Review: AOpen designs a small-form-factor PC for the living room. Do blue LED-lit transport controls and InterVideo's Instant-On software make for a good living room experience?

item.title: Radeon X850 Platinum Edition Review
item.description: Review: ATI kicks up the speed of their X800 line with the new X850 XT Platinum Edition. Through process technology improvements and a more substantial cooling solution, the company can squeeze out a few more MHz. Let's see how their new card stacks up.

item.title: ADV: FREE WHITE PAPER: White Paper: SSL VPNs: The Challenge of Delivering Both Flexibility and Security
item.description: The anywhere, anytime remote access connectivity provided by increasingly popular SSL VPNs can greatly increase the network’s vulnerability to a range of security threats. Deadly attacks can be launched from unsecured or compromised SSL VPN endpoints, so it is essential to ensure their security before granting them network access. Most important, because network-based SSL tunneling can bypass perimeter security, it exposes the network to many of the same threats seen at the perimeter. A comprehensive solution is available from Check Point Software Technologies Ltd., which offers a family of products for secure remote access, intranet and extranet VPNs.

item.title: Status check: Here's what I've dealt with
Setting up Intel's Matrix RAID for the ICH6R
item.description: Build It: Intel's Matrix RAID offers new, flexible ways to mix-and-match RAID formats for personal RAID. We show you how to set up a Matrix RAID array to maximize both performance and security.

item.title: IEEE Approves Japanese Wi-Fi Standard
item.description: The IEEE standards committee has approved the 802.11j standard, which will allow compliant North American Wi-Fi components to interoperate with similar devices in Japan.

item.title: USB Vibe
item.description: Getting a crick in your back or neck from sitting in front of that LCD all day long? USB Vibe, from GrandTec USA, offers a quick fix. It's a personal massager that plugs into any USB port on a desktop or laptop PC.

item.title: Benchmarking Half-Life 2: ATI vs. nVidia
item.description: The sequel to one of the greatest PC games of all time is finally upon us. With a state-of-the-art 3D engine, Half-Life 2 performance is sure to be hotly contested. We show you how to benchmark the game, and compare recent ATI and nVidia cards.

item.title: Four Hollywood Studios Back HD DVD Format
item.description: Toshiba Ltd. said that four major Hollywood studios had signed on to release titles in the HD DVD format, a decision that should have a significant impact on the next-generation DVD standards battle.

item.title: Sony, Partners Offer Glimpse Of New "Cell" Chip
item.description: IBM, Sony Corp., Sony Computer Entertainment, and Toshiba Corp. said Monday that the companies had "powered on" the first workstation designed around the collaboratively-designed "Cell" processor, which will begin pilot production next year.

item.title: Breakthrough in Hydrogen Production for Fuel Cells
item.description: The Idaho National Engineering and Environmental Laboratory and Ceramatec, Inc. are expected to reveal a breakthrough in hydrogen production research today.
